page.title: 02Housing - Deenethorpe
page.content:
The majority of homes are small, stone- built, detached houses...although short terraces were found in both Deene and Deenethorpe.All housing is owned by the Brudenell family, and many buildings date from the 17th & 18th centuries.
In Deenethorpe there are 6 detached cottages built in past centuries, each with a small garden, and a group of 6 terraced homes..dated from the 1950's. There is also a farm (Manor Farm), and a residence in the Porter's Lodge (part of the Brudenell's Deene Park gateway), situated a few hundred metres to the west of Deenethorpe, on the A43 road.
